Name: Mosaic of Berenice the Second
Description: The mosaic represents a portrait of Queen Berenice the Second, wife of Ptolemy the Third. She is shown with the prow of a ship on her head to symbolize the dynasty's naval power.The queen's face is full and the forehead is broad and rather low. Other facial features include her big prominent glistening eyes, large straight nose, small full mouth, and parted lips. The hair is divided in the middle, combed to the back and the left ear is partly visible. The mosaic bears the signature of Sophilos, the Greek artist.
